preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Claim
preliminary_notice.description: 15th of 2nd month (residential) or 3rd month (commercial)

lien_filing.name: Lien Affidavit
lien_filing.description: 15th of 3rd month (residential) or 4th month (commercial)

critical_warnings: ⚠️ ONGOING WORK: Must send monthly notices to protect each month's materials
Single notice only protects that month and future deliveries
Failure to send monthly notices may forfeit prior months' lien rights
TX.notes: Using commercial deadlines for MVP (longer = safer). Residential toggle coming in v2.

preliminary_notice.name: Preliminary Notice
preliminary_notice.description: Within 20 days of first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after completion (or 30 days if Notice of Completion recorded)

critical_warnings: ⚠️ 20-day preliminary notice deadline is strictly enforced
Late notice limits recovery to work within 20 days of notice
⚠️ Deadline can shorten to 30 days if Notice of Completion recorded
CA.notes: Showing 90-day standard deadline. Add warning about potential 30-day acceleration.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice to Owner (NTO)
preliminary_notice.description: Within 45 days of first furnishing (or before starting work)

lien_filing.name: Claim of Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Missing 45-day NTO deadline = COMPLETE LOSS of lien rights
Must record lien AND serve copy on owner within 15 days
Lien expires if lawsuit not filed within 1 year
FL.notes: Pro tip: Serve Notice to Owner BEFORE first delivery to eliminate deadline concerns.

preliminary_notice.name: None Required
preliminary_notice.description: No preliminary notice required for any claimants

lien_filing.name: Notice of Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 8 months for commercial/multi-family, 4 months for single-family residential

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must serve copy of lien on owner within 5 days before or 30 days after filing
⚠️ Residential projects have HALF the filing time (120 days vs 240 days)
NY.notes: No preliminary notice required. Using standard 240-day deadline for MVP (commercial). Residential toggle coming in v2.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Intent to Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Must serve notice at least 30 days before filing lien

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 6 months after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must serve Notice of Intent at least 30 days BEFORE filing lien
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 6 months of last work
PA.notes: Two-step process: Notice of Intent (30 days before) then Lien filing (within 6 months).

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Lien Claim
preliminary_notice.description: Must serve notice within 90 days of last furnishing

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 4 months after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must serve Notice of Lien Claim within 90 days of last work
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 4 months of last furnishing
IL.notes: Notice must be served before or with lien filing. Using 90-day notice deadline.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice to Contractor
preliminary_notice.description: Within 30 days of first furnishing (or before starting work)

lien_filing.name: Claim of Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Notice to Contractor must be served within 30 days of first work
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 90 days of last furnishing
GA.notes: Simple two-step process. Notice within 30 days, then lien within 90 days of last work.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Claim of Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Must serve notice within 120 days of last furnishing

lien_filing.name: Claim of Lien
lien_filing.description: Must file lien within 120 days of last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Notice and lien filing both have same 120-day deadline
⚠️ Must serve notice BEFORE or WITH lien filing
NC.notes: Notice and filing deadlines are the same. Must complete both within 120 days.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice to Owner
preliminary_notice.description: Within 60 days of first furnishing (or before starting work)

lien_filing.name: Claim of Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Notice to Owner must be served within 60 days of first work
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 90 days of last furnishing
WA.notes: Notice within 60 days of first work, then lien within 90 days of last work.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Commencement
preliminary_notice.description: No preliminary notice required - owner files Notice of Commencement

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 75 days after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must file lien within 75 days of last furnishing
⚠️ Owner files Notice of Commencement - no preliminary notice needed from suppliers
OH.notes: No preliminary notice required. Simple 75-day filing deadline from last work.

preliminary_notice.name: Preliminary 20-Day Notice
preliminary_notice.description: Within 20 days of first furnishing (or before starting work)

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 120 days after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ 20-day preliminary notice deadline is strictly enforced
⚠️ Late notice limits recovery to work within 20 days of notice
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 120 days of last furnishing
AZ.notes: Similar to California - strict 20-day notice requirement. Lien filing within 120 days.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Intent to Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Must serve notice at least 10 days before filing lien

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 4 months after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must serve Notice of Intent at least 10 days BEFORE filing lien
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 4 months of last furnishing
CO.notes: Short 10-day notice window before filing. Lien deadline is 120 days from last work.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Mechanic's Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Must serve notice within 90 days of last furnishing

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: 150 days after last furnishing labor or materials

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Must serve Notice within 90 days of last furnishing
⚠️ Lien must be filed within 150 days of last furnishing
⚠️ Notice must be served before lien filing
VA.notes: Notice deadline (90 days) is shorter than lien filing deadline (150 days). Both from last work.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Furnishing
preliminary_notice.description: Required for subcontractors/suppliers within 20 days of first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Claim of Lien
lien_filing.description: Must be filed within 90 days after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Late notice limits protection to work performed AFTER notice is served
Must serve lien on owner within 15 days of recording
'Last furnishing' excludes corrective work
MI.notes: Notice of Furnishing protects subcontractors and suppliers. Late notice still preserves rights but only for work after notice date. No residential/commercial deadline distinctions.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Nonpayment
preliminary_notice.description: Required for remote contractors within 90 days after last day of each month work was performed

lien_filing.name: Notice of Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after last furnishing (30 days if Notice of Completion filed)

critical_warnings: ⚠️ General contractors have 1 YEAR to file (not 90 days)
⚠️ Deadline accelerates to 30 days if Notice of Completion recorded
Notice of Nonpayment protects each month's work separately
TN.notes: General contractors have extended 1-year filing period. All others must file within 90 days (or 30 if completion notice filed). 'Last furnishing' excludes warranty work.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Identification
preliminary_notice.description: Required for sub-subcontractors and suppliers within 30 days of first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Statement of Account
lien_filing.description: 90 days after Notice of Substantial Completion OR 120 days after Notice of Termination

statute_citations: Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 254, § 4 (Notice of Identification)
Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 254, § 8 (Notice of Contract)
Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 254, § 10 (Statement of Account)
critical_warnings: ⚠️ COMPLEX: Multiple notice types required (Identification, Contract, Statement)
⚠️ Enforcement suit must be filed within 90 days of recording Statement
Deadlines triggered by formal Notices of Completion, not last work date
MA.notes: Massachusetts has the most complex lien process. Multiple notices required at different stages. Statement of Account filing deadline depends on which completion notice is filed.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Unpaid Balance
preliminary_notice.description: Mandatory for residential within 60 days; optional but recommended for commercial

lien_filing.name: Notice of Lien
lien_filing.description: 90 days after last furnishing (120 days for public projects)

statute_citations: N.J. Stat. Ann. § 2A:44A-8 (Notice of Unpaid Balance)
critical_warnings: ⚠️ RESIDENTIAL ONLY: Notice of Unpaid Balance is MANDATORY within 60 days
Public projects get extended 120-day filing period
'Last furnishing' excludes minor corrections
NJ.notes: Residential projects require Notice of Unpaid Balance within 60 days. Commercial projects: notice optional but recommended. Public projects have 120-day filing deadline.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Intent to Claim Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Subcontractors must serve notice within 120 days after last furnishing

lien_filing.name: Lien Petition
lien_filing.description: Must be filed within 180 days (6 months) after last work

statute_citations: Md. Code Ann., Real Prop. § 9-104 (Notice of Intent)
Md. Code Ann., Real Prop. § 9-105 (Lien Petition)
critical_warnings: ⚠️ Work must improve property value by 15% or more to qualify for lien
Enforcement suit must be commenced within 1 year of filing
'Last furnishing' excludes warranty work
MD.notes: One of the most generous deadlines (6 months). Notice of Intent required for subs. Unique requirement: work must increase property value by 15%+.

preliminary_notice.name: Subcontractor Identification Notice
preliminary_notice.description: Required within 60 days of first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Construction Lien
lien_filing.description: Must be recorded within 6 months (180 days) after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Notice of Intent to Lien must be served 30 days BEFORE filing
Very strict compliance requirements - follow statute exactly
'Last furnishing' excludes corrective work
WI.notes: Wisconsin has strict lien procedures. Two notices required: Identification Notice (60 days) and Intent Notice (30 days before filing). Long filing deadline (6 months) but rigid process.

preliminary_notice.name: Preliminary Notice
preliminary_notice.description: Subcontractors must serve on owner within 45 days of first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien Statement
lien_filing.description: Must be filed within 120 days after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Late preliminary notice limits lien to unpaid balance at time of notice
Enforcement suit must be commenced within 1 year
Serve lien on owner after filing
MN.notes: Standard 45-day preliminary notice protects subcontractors. Late notice reduces lien amount to balance owed when notice finally served. 120-day filing deadline.

preliminary_notice.name: Preliminary Notice
preliminary_notice.description: 30 days (repair/remodel) or 60 days (new residential) from first furnishing

lien_filing.name: Notice of Intention to Hold Lien
lien_filing.description: 60 days for residential, 90 days for commercial after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ RESIDENTIAL vs COMMERCIAL: Different deadlines for both notice AND filing
Residential repair: 30-day notice, 60-day filing
Residential new construction: 60-day notice, 60-day filing
Commercial: 90-day filing
IN.notes: Indiana distinguishes between residential repairs, residential new construction, and commercial. Residential has accelerated deadlines. Enforcement suit within 1 year.

preliminary_notice.name: Notice of Intent to Lien
preliminary_notice.description: Required at least 10 days before filing for subcontractors/suppliers

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: Must be filed within 6 months (180 days) after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Notice of Intent must be sent 10+ days BEFORE filing lien
Equipment rentals require additional 15-day notice
'Last furnishing' excludes warranty work
MO.notes: Straightforward process: 10-day pre-filing notice, then 6-month filing window. One of the longer deadlines. Serve on owner after filing.

preliminary_notice.name: None Required (Optional Notice of Furnishing)
preliminary_notice.description: No mandatory preliminary notice; optional Notice of Furnishing recommended before final payment

lien_filing.name: Mechanic's Lien
lien_filing.description: Must be filed within 90 days after last furnishing

critical_warnings: ⚠️ Enforcement suit PLUS lis pendens required within 6 months of filing
Failure to file lawsuit within 6 months = lien expires
'Last furnishing' excludes corrective work
SC.notes: Simple filing process: no preliminary notice required. 90-day filing deadline. Critical: must file enforcement lawsuit within 6 months or lien expires automatically.
